Talk_30:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:QuestionNormal>I'm guessing from the way you dress that
you're not a <clr:0000>Cece fan<clr:ffff>, traveler.<sp:0:4:0>This village started out as a quiet,
peaceful burg where we focused on
living off the land.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Sigh_00>Things sure have been different since the
decorations <clr:0000>Cece<clr:ffff> put up everywhere have
been bringing in the tourists.<sp:5:0:0>
Talk_31:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Did you know that we're set to hold an
election for mayor here soon, traveler?<sp:0:4:0>Sure, I understand Cece's position on
the issues.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>But that don't change Hateno's tradition
of living off the land.
Talk_32:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>But I don't mean to talk your ear off.<sp:5:0:0>
By all means, go on and have yourself
a peaceful stay here.
Talk_33:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Don't I remember seeing you at the
mayoral election?
Talk_20:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughL_01>Reede's not resting on his laurels after
winning another term as mayor.<sp:0:4:0>I hear he's hard at work on a <clr:0000>new Hateno
specialty <clr:ffff>to follow up Hateno cheese.<sp:0:4:0>Last I heard, he and <clr:0000>Nack <clr:ffff>were putting
their heads together at the pasture near
the village entrance.
Talk_23:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:TalkDeny_01>They've been putting these strange
decorations all over the village.
Talk_24:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:SurpriseS_00>Errr, <sp:5:0:0>sorry about that.<sp:0:4:0>You caught me as I was eating my daily
Hateno veggies. <sp:5:0:0>They're very nutritious!<sp:5:0:0>
How else do you think I've lived this long?
Talk_11:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>Y'know something? I really enjoyed that
Hylian shroom from dear Cece.<sp:0:4:0>But in the end, I'm always going to like
carrots better than mushrooms.
Talk_25:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Admiration_00>Are you hungry, by chance? <sp:5:0:0>I'm in the
middle of my own meal, but...<sp:0:4:0>The <clr:0000>general store<clr:ffff> by the village entrance
has a nice selection of seasonal <clr:0000>tomatoes<clr:ffff>
and such right now.
Talk_26:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Admiration_01>Errr...sorry about that. Are you a visitor
here? A tourist?<sp:0:4:0>You caught me as I was eating my daily
Hateno veggies. <sp:5:0:0>They're very nutritious!<sp:5:0:0>
How else do you think I've lived this long?
Talk_14:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_01>Phew...<sp:5:0:0>the years are taking their toll.<sp:5:0:0>
A few more steps and I can rest.
Talk_27:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Admiration_00>Have you tried a <clr:0000>sun pumpkin<clr:ffff> yet?
They're the new big thing in Hateno!<sp:0:4:0>I can't believe they figured out a way to
get Cece's unique flair into a vegetable.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>You can count on Reede to surprise you,
no doubt about that.
Talk_15: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Good morning. Are you headed out early?
Talk_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:TalkDeny_01>What strange decorations they've been
putting up...
Talk_28:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>You're in Hateno, <clr:0000>a village known for
living off the land<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>For as long as anyone can remember,
we've tilled the soil and let nature be
our guide in life.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Understand_01>Now, though...<sp:5:0:0>everything's getting so
glitzy as some folks try to drum up more
tourism business.<sp:0:4:0>Mind you, we were all happy to see <clr:0000>Cece<clr:ffff>
return to the village after she'd been
away for so long.<sp:0:4:0>Some folks, like my daughter Prima,
started wearing that flashy <clr:0000>Cece-brand<clr:ffff>
stuff right away in celebration.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>But it's a tad over the top for me and my
son-in-law Worten. We prefer the simple
life, the way we've always lived it.<sp:5:0:0>
Talk_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_01>Have you been traveling long? If you want
to rest, Ton Pu Inn is straight ahead.
Talk_29:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Trouble>This village started out as a quiet,
peaceful burg where we focused on
living off the land.
Talk_17:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_00>The sun's well and truly set. If you need
a place to stay for the night, I recommend
Ton Pu Inn.
Talk_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Admiration_01>Seems like they're getting closer to
holding that election for mayor.<sp:0:4:0>Cece is a popular choice with the youth,
seems like. <sp:5:0:0>I suppose it's natural that
things change with the times.<sp:0:4:0>But if it was up to me, I'd want Reede to
keep doing itâ€”the way he's always done.
Talk_18:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad_00>Unfortunate weather, isn't it? The good
news is that Ton Pu Inn straight ahead
from here can offer shelter from the rain.
Talk_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>Won't be long now before they're ready
to hold that election for mayor.<sp:0:4:0>Both Reede and Cece mean well for our
village. That much is plain to see.<sp:0:4:0>The question on my mind is, what are they
going to do to preserve the traditions we
built this place on?
Talk_19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_01>Errr...<sp:5:0:0>sorry about that. Are you a visitor
here? <sp:5:0:0>A tourist?
Talk_06:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_00>Well, the election wasn't such a disaster
after all. <sp:5:0:0>I wasn't sure how it would all
come out for a while there.<sp:0:4:0>But Cece has a healthy appreciation for
Hateno produce, which is good to know.<sp:0:4:0>Maybe I should give those weird outfits
and decorations she makes another
chance, for fairness' sake.
